channel.title: Staff role restructure
channel.description:
Tom and I were discussing a staff restructure recently and we came to the conclusion that we needed to add roles into the mix. This gives moderators specific responsibilities and will minimise issues like "that's not my job" (not that it's happening now anyway). It also gives leadership to the moderators so they're not lost sheep and don't know what to do. :P
Anyway, i'll post below what I have come up with so far. These tasks are susceptible to change so make sure you keep up with your specific roles. Also just because you've been given a specific role doesn't mean you can't perform another, you just aren't obliged to. (but it is nice to help others!)
Moparisthebest - Overall administration (Mopar site founder) Tom - Overall administration of server & forums + technical management Zuppers - Server/Community management + technical management Si Force - Community relations Fuscate - Spawn watch, land disputes, new member set-up, event ideas, member abuse watch Kickingjamie - Member abuse watch, New member set-up, event ideas, bug abuse watch, spawn watch, nether hub maintenance Manbearpig - Member abuse watch, new member set-up, event ideas, nether hub maintenance
You may have noticed that some moderators have received more responsibility than others, and that is down to activity mainly. We have given moderators who are more active around the community more tasks as we know these will be carried out more frequently and with reliability. If you're up to taking on more tasks, feel free to volunteer. I'll briefly go through what each task involves below:
[u]New member set-up[/u]: While some new members may like to be left alone, there are others who are more reliable on others. It is now your job to help these members by suggesting places in which they can locate and perhaps even team up with other members of the community. We don't expect you to give them free stuff, although feel free to do so, but we expect you to be mature and helpful to these members.
[u]Event ideas[/u]: All moderators have this role. We want all of you to think collectively and suggest ideas for future server events. Things such as spleef championships and other such games are a great way to bring the community together. Please feel free to suggest events, competitions and other such trivial festivities. We want to encourage it.
[u]Spawn watch[/u]: Those with this task are expected to keep an eye on the spawn and make sure it is kept in good order. By this I mean filling massive, pointless holes if you get the time and perhaps removing abandoned shacks and the likes. If you feel there's a questionable building that may or may not pass for being removed, contact me and I'll give my opinion on it.
[u]Land disputes[/u]: I don't expect too many of these for now, but when we start advertising people will be driven closer and closer together. This will inevitably cause land disputes and similar problems, so here a moderator must visit the scene and then decide the outcome. Please take into consideration who was there first, but also take into account that the original settler may have an unreasonable amount of land, which is not in the servers best interests.
[u]Nether hub maintenance[/u]:
Maintenance of the nether hub, you make sure everything is nice and pretty. If something needs fixing, please fix it. If you need materials to fix it, I'll provide them, so just ask me. If a member needs help connecting his portal to the hub, you are obliged to give them some sort of assistance, whether it be giving them direction or helping to dig their tunnels, that's up to you.
[u]Member & bug abuse watch[/u]: Member abuse occurs frequently online, in fact I see it everyday on Moparscape. On a minecraft server though it can be more than just verbal abuse, as the offender can assault, annoy and otherwise disturb what another minecraft player may be trying to do. We want to discourage this as we want a friendly enviroment on the server, not an elitist one. Therefore who ever is in with this task must discourage member abuse and help foster a kinder relationship. Bug abuse is basically the same, please report to us any bugs/glitches on the server that the members may take advantage of.
That's basically it for now, if you could please post below confirming you understand your assigned duties. All moderators are expected to handle reports. And if you're all wondering, I get all of the above roles.. lucky me :rolleyes:. These changes are gearing the staff team towards becoming a functional, efficient unit for when advertising commences, (which I believe will be very soon) so be on your toes!
On another note, there's a new award called 'Spleef Champion' being added shortly (whenever Moparisthebest gets around to it), so we'll be looking to give that out as well as a way to hand out the redstone award.
